questions.question: A group of 4 friends paid a total of $50.24 for tickets to a museum. Each friend paid the same amount for a ticket. How much did each friend pay for a ticket to the museum?

There are 160 employees who work for a company. The histogram summarizes the amount of time each employee has been in his or her current position at the company. Based on the histogram, which statement must be true?
options: There are 5 employees who have been at their current position for 30-35 months.
There are 6-11 employees who have been at their current position for 15 months.
Half of the employees have been at their current position 18 or more months.
Half of the employees have been at their current position 11 or fewer months.
questions.correctAnswer: Half of the employees have been at their current position 11 or fewer months.

questions.question: The circles in the model represent positive and negative units. Which equation is true based on the model?
Which list shows the numbers in order from greatest to least value?
Mauricio saves the same amount from his paycheck each week. The table shows the total amount of money saved based on the number of weeks. Which list shows the dependent quantities from the table?
The table shows the low temperature in degrees Fahrenheit for a city each day for 12 days. What is the range of the temperatures in the table?
What is the value of the expression shown? 4(-2) + (-10) + 3(-8)

The bar graph shows the flavors of gum bought yesterday by the customers at a store. Each customer bought only 1 flavor of gum. Which statement is NOT supported by the data displayed in the bar graph?
options: The same number of customers bought peppermint as the number of customers who bought cinnamon.
There were 120 customers who bought gum yesterday.
There were 2.5 times as many customers who bought spearmint as customers who bought peppermint.
questions.correctAnswer: There were 120 customers who bought gum yesterday.

questions.question: Which expression is equivalent to 53p + (16p + 7p)?

A portion of Taquan's check register is shown. Before Taquan made his utility payment on March 24, the balance of his account was $1,094.80. Based on the information in the check register, what was the balance of Taquan's checking account in dollars and cents after the transaction on March 29?
Which list of angle measures could be the angle measures of a triangle?
There is a 1 in 8 chance of a player winning a game. Which value is equivalent to the chance of the player winning a game?
Dennis made an extra $245.00 for selling furniture. The extra $245.00 was 7% of the total value of the furniture he sold. What was the total value of the furniture Dennis sold?
The rectangular model is made up of squares. Each square is of equal size. What percentage of the model is shaded?
The table shows the ratio of people who ate a certain type of lunch to the total number of people who ate lunch. A total of 840 people ate lunch. Which statement is true?
options: Half as many people ate a turkey sandwich as ate a vegetarian sandwich.
One-fourth as many people ate a vegetarian sandwich as ate a salad.
There were 56 more people who ate a turkey sandwich than ate a chicken sandwich.
There were 28 more people who ate a salad than ate a chicken sandwich.
questions.correctAnswer: There were 28 more people who ate a salad than ate a chicken sandwich.

questions.question: What is the value of the expression shown? 6 + (-4)³
Alma reads 2 books each week. Which number line best represents the number of weeks it will take her to read at least 28 books?
The dimensions of the rectangular prism are given in feet. What is the volume of the rectangular prism in cubic feet?
At a bookstore the total cost of 6 books is $45.00. Each book costs the same amount. Which table shows the relationship between the number of books bought and the total cost in dollars?

A grocery store orders 4 large containers of milk for every 7 small containers of milk. Which ratio could represent the number of large containers of milk to small containers of milk in an order from the grocery store?
A certain type of brass contains 65% copper. How many pounds of copper are contained in 120 pounds of the brass?
The box plot summarizes the finishing times for the runners in a race. Which statement is best supported by the data in the box plot?
options: Approximately 50% of the finishing times were less than 25 minutes.
Approximately 1/4 of the finishing times were greater than 28 minutes.
Approximately 25% of the finishing times were in the interval 20-22 minutes.
Approximately 3/4 of the finishing times were in the interval 15-30 minutes.
questions.correctAnswer: Approximately 1/4 of the finishing times were greater than 28 minutes.

questions.question: The length of the base of a parallelogram is 14 centimeters, and the corresponding height is h centimeters. Which formula can be used to find A, the area of the parallelogram in square centimeters?
Which value represents a percentage between 11% and 17%?
Which equation is NOT true?
Ms. Versini applied for a car loan from a bank. Which statement best describes the importance of Ms. Versini's credit report to the bank?
options: The report shows the likelihood that Ms. Versini will pay back the entire loan on time.
The report shows the highest level of education that Ms. Versini has reached.
The bank gives higher interest rates to people with higher credit scores.
The bank gives partial loans to people with strong credit.
questions.correctAnswer: The report shows the likelihood that Ms. Versini will pay back the entire loan on time.

questions.question: The length of a marathon race is 26 miles 385 yards. What is the total length of the marathon race in yards?

The table shows the amount of sugar Felisha mixes with each amount of water she puts in her hummingbird feeder. Based on the information in the table, how many cups of sugar should Felisha mix with 6 cups of water?

Two expressions are shown. The second expression is not complete. Expression I: 200r - (-110) Expression II: □ + 200r What number belongs in the box so that Expression I is equivalent to Expression II?
The table shows the relationship between b, the number of slices of bread, and c, the total number of calories in the bread. Which equation represents the relationship between b and c?
A baseball traveled 330 feet in 5 seconds. Which rate is equivalent to the rate at which the baseball traveled?
The length of a rectangle is 7 inches, and the area of the rectangle is 199.5 square inches. What is the width of the rectangle in inches?
Jaida worked 21 1/2 hours last week. She earned $11.60 per hour of work. How much money did Jaida earn last week?
In a neighborhood 12 1/40 of the lots have three or more trees. Which percentage is equivalent to the portion of lots in the neighborhood with three or more trees?
The perimeter of a triangle is 104 units. The combined length of two of the sides of the triangle is 64 units. What is the length of the third side of the triangle in units?
The dot plot shows the number of packages mailed by the last 20 customers at a post office. Which statement best describes the data shown in the dot plot?
options: The peak of the data is at 10.

questions.question: Point Q is located on the coordinate grid at (-9.73, -3.32). In which quadrant is point Q located?
In a recipe 3 eggs are used to make 45 cookies. Which table shows the relationship between the number of eggs used and the number of cookies made?
